She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Tony Parisi
items.content:
Tony Parisi is a Metaverse and virtual reality pioneer, inventor, entrepreneur, investor, author and musician. He has co-created several international 3D graphics standards, including VRML, X3D, and glTF. Tony is the author of O’Reilly Media’s foundational books on 3D graphics and VR, Learning Virtual Reality (2015), Programming 3D Applications in HTML5 and WebGL (2014), and WebGL Up and Running (2012).

One of the leading spokespeople for the immersive industry, Tony has given speeches in multiple countries about industry trends and innovation in augmented reality. He was named in Next Reality’s 30 People to Watch in Augmented Reality in 2020.

Tony is currently serving as Chief Strategy Officer at Lamina1, a new layer 1 blockchain for the Metaverse. He is also an advisor and limited partner in early stage venture firms including ME Ventures, a future-focused investment fund providing opportunities for creators to grow and succeed. Previously, Tony was Head of XR Ads and E-Commerce at Unity, where he oversaw strategy and product for the company’s real-time 3D brand advertising and commerce solutions.

Tony is also a composer and musician. He is currently finishing the cast recording for Judgment Day, a full-length original musical, and has several other music projects underway.

items.title: Will Knecht
items.content:
As Chairman and Chief Brand Officer of American manufacturer Wendell August Forge, Will Knecht is charged with leading the strategy and future focus of his company.

He is passionate about the future of our phygital world, the blending of the physical and the digital to offer compelling, immersive brand experiences.

items.title: Jake Steinerman
items.content: As the Head of Community at Spatial, Jake is leading a community of artists, designers, and creators, as well as a vast network of partners, in building a metaverse for culture.  He has worked in the space for nearly a decade, helping everyone from Fortune 500 enterprise & consumer brands, to individual creators, create engaging augmented & virtual reality experiences for their audiences. Now at Spatial, which is at the unique intersection of the metaverse and NFTs, is building the community of the next generation of the internet and global connectivity.

items.title: Engaging Your Customers
items.content: Richard Ward founder of Ready Player Golf shares with us his concept of his self-named unit of attention "Richards Per Minute."

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Richard Ward
items.content:
Founder of ReadyPlayerGolf.com the oldest and largest charity event in the Metaverse. An annual gathering where industry friends get together, play some cooperative games, and raise funds for a worthy cause. This year it\'s the Children\'s Cancer Research Foundation.

Also, Head of Metaverse for McKinsey & Company

items.title: Empowering Brands in Mixed Worlds
items.content: Join us in a discussion with creators and innovators who are shaping the future of XR and Web3 experiences. Hear real-world examples, and learn about a variety of technologies, emerging trends, and immersive experiences across brands, content, entertainment, fashion, and the future of retail.

items.title: Bobby Carlton
items.content:
Bobby Carlton has worked in immersive technology industry since 2016 when he became the Director of VRLearn at the MASIE Center, working with enterprise learning leader Elliott Masie and helping organizations and government agencies understand how AR/VR/XR technology could make people better learners.

In 2017 he joined VRScout as a writer and continued to work with multiple organizations as an XR consultant. He is also on the SXSW XR Pitch Advisory Board.

In 2022, he joined FS Studio to become their XR/VR Content Manager bringing his years of experience to projects in robotics, automation, infrastructure, mechatronics, marketing, and workforce training.

items.title: Val Vacante
items.content:
Val Vacante is an award-winning global innovator; as the VP of Solutions Innovation at Dentsu, she uncovers cultural trends, commerce dynamics and emerging technologies to shape next-generation product innovations, and solutions impacting the way people connect and experience in the physical and digital world.

Val is the visionary and co-creator behind ShopNXT™ — dentsu’s award-winning patent-pending retail innovations named “top product picks,” at CES by PCR Magazine, “top tools shaping the future of retail” by Adweek, featured in CNET, The Drum, PSFK Retail Innovation Week, eMarketer, MediaPost, PCR, TechAcute among others.

Additionally, Val architected and launched NXT Intelligence™ an innovation platform featuring 12 technology, innovation, and brand solutions designed to rapidly explore, evaluate and evolve business growth opportunities. Her latest work focuses on connected experiences, the evolution of the metaverse, mixed worlds, gaming, retail and play.

She is also the founder of Collabsco where she pioneered the first connected play landscape, mapping 260+ emerging technologies and connected experiences featured in VentureBeat, The Drum, and VRScout.

Her portfolio includes over 50+ brands: Hasbro, Mattel, Disney, Bandai Namco Entertainment, WowWee, AT&T, Vodafone, Nestlé, Mercedes-Benz, MINI, Honeywell, Sleep Number, Dell, MERGE, Virsix Games, among others.

Val has recently been named one of the Top 25 Women in Tech by PCR magazine, The Most Powerful Women in Technology, 2022 by CIO Views and 40 Over Forty.

She serves on the Fast Company Executive Board, SXSW Innovation Advisory Board, is a Global Expert to MassChallenge, an international speaker and writer.

items.title: Briar Prestidge
items.content:
Briar Prestidge is a serial entrepreneur and CEO of Prestidge Group a leading personal branding, PR and speaker relations agency managing HNWI, C-level executives, technology experts, celebrities, government officials and investors, with offices in Dubai, New York, and London.

A qualified Digital Marketer, Speech-Language Pathologist and Neuro-Linguistic Programming Business Practitioner with an international career for both private and government sectors (originally from a farm in New Zealand), Briar is obsessed with PR, emerging tech, VR/AR and the metaverse, continual learning, business and entrepreneurship.

Prior to establishing Prestidge Group, Briar led communication and digital teams, including executive branding, for many public/ private sector companies, including a government agency rebrand (both digital and comms lead), overseeing all communication touch points, crisis comms strategy, media training for VIPs, and press launch for regional/ international media.

Briar also has a corporate power suit collection BRIAR PRESTIDGE - The Label (www.briarprestidge.com), made from fine wool and cashmere. In 2022, they created their virtual spin-off collection for avatars and dropped NFT suits on leading VR platform, Decentraland, at the World’s First Metaverse Fashion Week.

Briar is also a Strategic Advisor for Scopernia, specialized in preparing companies for a future in Web3, and she sits on the board for the Metaverse Fashion Council.

She was named ‘Top 100 Most Influential’ in the United Arab Emirates, and she has been featured across Entrepreneur, Forbes, OSN, Emirates Women, Marie Claire, Grazia and The National in recognition of her work. In 2022, Briar also received a lot of publicity around her experiment where she spent ’48 hours in the metaverse’ and through her virtual reality world hopping productions.

As a mentor for startups, Briar works with The Founders Institute and one of the world\'s largest entrepreneurial networks, TiE, and she also provides one-on-one and group session consulting.

Briar advocates the role of a healthy body and mind for entrepreneurs and corporate professionals, which is why she wrote the recipe book “Hunger for Success – A recipe book for businesspeople who hate cooking,” to be released in 2022.

When Briar isn’t working or travelling, you can find her at the gym, Pilates or running, spending time with friends (in real life or virtually…), or studying something new.

items.title: Marco Carvalho
items.content:
Marco Carvalho is a visionary entrepreneur who creates transformational technologies, products, and immersive experiences by remixing gaming, film, education, work, and play in the physical and digital world.

Marco is the CEO of HeadOffice.Space where he’s co-creating the world’s first metaverse on the moon, designed for the ever-changing way remote teams work, play, learn and engage — building a sense of belonging, fostering a culture of connection, community, creativity, and productivity.
Marco is an Endeavor Entrepreneur (endeavor.org), multi-award-winning creative director, inventor, and co-founder of global brands, products, and companies in the USA, UK, China, and Brazil.

He has driven innovative products and experiences for over eighteen years across immersive content, art, games, technology, education, adventure parks, and global distribution with over ten years focused on developing AR, VR, and voice/sound technologies.

Marco has partnered with leading global technology, entertainment, games, and consumer product companies, including Universal Studios, WarnerBros., Disney, Amazon, Qualcomm, developing businesses, IPs, products & technology globally.

Marco’s work has been featured on the global stage of innovation as a CES Innovation honoree 2019; Cinequest 2020 best VR Roomscale, 2014 Best Educational toy in France (with Bandai) among others, he serves as a mentor and international speaker featured at Amazon, Qualcomm, UKTI, Harvard University, and Berkeley University.

items.title: Setting A High Bar for Avatars
items.content: Celebrities demand fidelity in how they are represented. Performance to digital fashion count for brands entering the metaverse. Can platforms innovations keep pace with the expectations they set?

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Veronica Orvalho
items.content:
Verónica Orvalho is the founder and CEO of Didimo. She has translated years of research, data science, and computer graphics expertise into a patented technology platform to create digital humans, empowering people to engage more authentically and humanly in digital spaces. This breakthrough provides the next evolution of how humans will engage the world around them.

Veronica earned a Ph.D. in Computer Graphics and is a professor at Porto University. She has lived and worked on three continents, with companies like IBM, Sony, Amazon, Universal Studios, and more.

items.title: Amany Alkhayat
items.content: Amany is an Instructional designer, researcher, Voice User Interface designer, author, and teacher trainer. She is currently pursuing her doctoral degree in the Instructional Technology and Media program at Teachers College, Columbia University. She’s co-hosts Metaverse Adventures at the Immersive Learning Research Network. She founded the VirtuaTELL conference at NYS TESOL in 2021 that brings together educators, practitioners, researchers, and passionate enthusiasts to work together to integrate emerging technologies into education. Her research interests include conversational AI, Extended Reality for education, immersive storytelling, intelligent NFTs and decentralized autonomous organizations.

items.title: Andy Stack
items.content: Andy has long had a passion for mixing art with business and cutting-edge technology to help artists create sustainable magic. Most recently he was Chief Product Officer for Hanai World, a phygital entertainment company led by Cirque du Soleil founder Guy Laliberte, bringing the human performance to new forms of XR and LBE experiences. Andy is a founder of Arcturus, a 3D video software company that enables the authoring, editing and streaming of volumetrically captured performances. Prior to Arcturus, Andy was the creator-focused product manager at YouTube responsible for launching monetization, analytics, payments and reporting solutions for YouTube partners. In early 2015 he shifted his focus to creating YouTube’s initial VR content strategy, launching YouTube’s 360 video feature with top creator content, and leading production for the first stereoscopic 360 music videos. Prior to YouTube, Andy was a serial entrepreneur who co-founded, grew and sold 3 media-tech companies after earning his Wharton MBA and Princeton electrical engineering degrees. Andy is also an avid drummer, stage performer, and arts patron: He toured with a jam band in the late 90\'s, was a trained performer in the Blue Man Group in the early 00\'s, and is now an advisor, executive producer or board member to various creator-focused initiatives.

items.title: The MetaVRse Mall
items.content: At 100 floors, 100 million square feet, TheMall promises to be the largest virtual retail and entertainment destination in the Metaverse.  Co-Founder Alan Smithson will give a live tour of the new revolutionary 3D real-time interactive website for TheMall, built on the web based MetaVRse Engine.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: The Road to Mass Consumer Adoption
items.content: Taking this new medium to scale is the key to world-wide adoption and monetization. A discussion with Bob Bjarke from Meta about what it will take to get the immersive industry to a place where this medium will become a part of the daily life of a consumer.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Bob Bjarke
items.content: Bob Bjarke is a creative leader with nearly 20 years of creative development, design and technology experience. Bob is currently exploring the creative potential of the metaverse and AI while @Meta, and has built creative campaigns in digital and traditional spaces for some of the biggest brands in the world. In addition to partnering with the most highly regarded creative agencies in North America, Bob has also developed innovative new mobile ad products with teams of Meta engineers and product managers.

items.title: What Happens on the Headset Stays on the Headset
items.content: Striking the balance between how sensors capture biometric and environmental data in order to function, without violating a user's privacy is fundamental to ethical concerns about XR.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Aura Freeman
items.content: Aura Freeman is Co-founder of Atom Futures, a cultural research, futures and brand strategy agency based in London. Her background is in research, campaigning and strategy in the not-for-profit sector and with brands. She has designed and implemented global social and policy change campaigns for several international organisations, including Amnesty International, on issues such as online safety and freedom of speech.

items.title: Katitza Rodriguez Pereda
items.content: Katitza Rodriguez is EFF's Policy Director for Global Privacy. She concentrates on comparative policy of global privacy issues, with special emphasis on emerging technology and cross border data flows. Katitza's work also focuses on cybersecurity and government access to data at the intersection of international human rights law and standards. Katitza also supervises EFF's growing Latin American team. She was an advisor to the UN Internet Governance Forum (2009-2010). In 2018, CNET named Katitza one of the 20 most influential Latinos in technology in the United States. In 2014, she was also named one of "The heroes in the fight to save the Internet".

items.title: Avi Bar-Zeev
items.content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

items.title: Facilitating Branded Events
items.content: The Metaverse doesn't just open opportunities to create payment rails for existing physical products or services, but it also creates opportunities for alternative revenues streams through selling goods/services exclusively available virtually.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Athena Demos
items.content: Athena Demos is co-founder and CEO of Big Rock Creative (BRC), an award-winning XR experience company creating groundbreaking experiences for global clients. Big Rock Creative won the Producer’s Guild Award for Innovation, the Aurea Award for creativity, the No Proscenium award for Best VR experience of 2020, the Hermes' Platinum Award, and the Auggie Award for Best Societal Impact of 2022. With over 20 years of experience producing iconic events, like the LA Burning Man Decompression Arts and Music Celebration, as well as the Art of Change Inaugural Ball for President Obama in LA, she transitioned to the metaverse to produce BRCvr (Black Rock City Virtual Reality). BRCvr is an official virtual Burning Man Experience whose scope is unprecedented in the VR space. Athena produced internationally recognized social impact projects such as Breonna’s Garden which premiered at SXSW 2022. She has developed a philosophical approach to guiding humanity to build a foundational fabric for creative collaboration in the metaverse. As a result, she has been quoted in leading books, articles and spoken at leading industry events.

items.title: Anne-Marie Enns
items.content: Anne-Marie is an award-winning Event Producer who loves bringing together inspiring people to create incredible connections.  She is the Executive Producer of the Immerse Global Summit and Global Event Director for the VR/AR Association.  Anne-Marie also serves as an Ambassador for Mission Impact, a Global Leadership Development program focusing on business-critical web3 training, personal growth, and impact for women so that they can accelerate their leadership within the organization and in the world.  She is proud to be on the Advisory Board of  The Women of the Future, Web3 & Metaverse Book.  Anne-Marie loves using the stages at her events to give a platform for voices that need to be heard.

items.title: Sonya Haskins
items.content: Sonya Haskins is a respected voice in the XR industry and Head of Programming at AWE (Augmented World Expo). In 2019, Sonya founded VR Community Builders and she actively encourages positive, inclusive communities through engagement and training. She's also an avid journalist and has written eight books.

items.title: Building Branded Digital Twin Experiences
items.content: Eventually, studios are going to need to provide immersive content to keep consumers engaged. How exactly is that going to work when premium content services enter the Metaverse?

items.title: Celeste Lear
items.content: Event producer, immersive experience designer & music director/artist Celeste Lear is a Los Angeles based XR professional with 2 decades of discipline within the digital entertainment & audio/visual world. She has lead various teams working with DreamlandXR & has worked on ground breaking projects with world renown production crews to turn out consistently well planned & executed futuristic events, including, high tech multi-media installation experiences, video mapping, conferences, immersive festivals & concerts - both physically and in VR in the metaverse. Founder of Boutique Electronique Music, her work is also centered around the most current tech and trends for AV, sound engineering, performance, music curation, music direction and broadcast. She has a special passion for projects around environmental sustainability, human connection & the arts.

items.title: Gabe Baker
items.content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

items.title: Christi Fenison
items.content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

items.title: Doug Jacobson
items.content:
Doug is a co-founder of Big Rock Creative, a XR company producing large
scale events in VR. Big Rock’s first large project, BRCvr, created a fully
immersive Burning Man festival in social VR starting in 2020 which generated
much positive PR including an article in Wired Magazine. Big Rock Creative
won the Producer's Guild innovation award and the Aurea Award. He has
since worked on projects ranging from directing an XR music video featuring
Pitbull, facilitating a Hollywood red carpet premiere in VR or creative directing
the VR version of "Breonna's Garden" that premiered in SXSW 2022.
Doug’s background is in the film industry, he graduated from USC film school
in the 90s with honors. Over the course of his career, he has written,
directed, produced, and edited several festival award-winning narratives and
documentaries. His most notorious documentary features the Burning Man
festival called, “Journey to the flames” which has been screened nationally
and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
American Renaissance” and “The Secret Lives of Adult Stars”, and co-edited
the award-winning short doc “Selling Lies”.

items.title: The Brand Experience IP Landscape
items.content: Protecting intellectual property on the frontier of a new medium.

items.title: Han Kim
items.content:
Han Kim is an attorney in the Entertainment, Technology and Advertising Practice Group at SheppardMullin.

Han’s practice focuses on transactional entertainment matters that span from the cutting-edge intersection of technology and entertainment to traditional entertainment industries. He advises clients on business transactions related to music, television, feature film, podcast, metaverse (VR/AR), blockchain/NFTs, esports and games.

Forward-thinking and entrepreneurial by nature, Han works closely with companies, talents, producers, and entrepreneurs that disrupt, and bring innovations to, various entertainment industries. Han provides added value to his clients’ work by structuring novel business models, presenting practical risk management solutions for their operations, and leveraging his industry relationships.

items.title: Cynthia Maller
items.content: Cynthia Maller is Head of 3D Creative Technology at Walmart, and three of its digitally-native brands: Hayneedle, Art.com and Allswell. She is also a Certified Emotional Intelligence (EQ) Practitioner. Her focus is strengthening and scaling the three pillars of 3D in retail: inspiring aesthetics, visual integrity and operational excellence. She believes that every one of us has the talent and capability to add value to immersive commerce, and to be a builder, a citizen and a purveyor in the Metaverse. This drives her commitment to peer education, advocacy and invention. When she’s not at work, she’s on the ice, feeding her passion for figure skating. Her drive to try new things, to push herself, both in commerce technology and on the ice, is guided by the words of Erin Hanson, “What if I fall? Oh, but my darling, What if you fly?

items.title: Gregg Katano
items.content:
Gregg is a media entrepreneur, speaker, educator, and business and marketing strategist with experience in extended reality, virtual world events, location-based entertainment, and emerging media and technologies.

Gregg is currently serving as Senior Vice-President of U.S. Operations / Partner, of HOLOGATE, the world’s most successful immersive media company for location-based entertainment with 13,000,000+ players-to-date across 38 countries around the globe; Co-Vice Chair of the Producers Guild of America ‘New Media Council’ (2nd Term); and Partner and Co-Event Director of DreamlandXR. He also an advisory board member of SXSW ‘Pitch’; ‘Kollab’, which supports thousands of LA youth of the Boys and Girls Clubs of America; and the Cal State University Entertainment Alliance (CSUEA). Previously, Gregg was Chief Strategist / Evangelist at ‘Unofficial Cardboard’, the pioneering and leading Google-Certified producer of ‘Google Cardboard VR’.

Gregg’s speaking engagements include the Augmented World Expo (AWE), Consumer Electronic Show (CES), Game Developer’s Conference (GDC); National Association of Broadcasters (NAB); Dubai Game Conference, Comic-Con, WonderCon, IBC Show | Amsterdam, SIGGRAPH, SXSW, Mobile World Congress, VR/AR Global Summit, Amusement Expo/VR Summit, G2E-Global Game Expo, and many others.

items.title: Unlocking Immersive Brand Activations
items.content: The final panel of the day addresses the gatekeepers of major brands, how agencies plan to onboard their clients to experiential advertising.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Brian Hutchinson
items.content: Brian currently leads the Production Services group at The Mars Agency, which is comprised of a robust team of production design, finishing, retouching, asset management, execution and print production.  He has over 20 years of experience in leading executions for some of the largest CPG\'s and retailers in the industry, both from the lense of the agency, as well as the solution provider.  Brian also leads the Disruptive Technologies & Innovation group, focusing on Metaverse, NFTs and Augmented Reality experiences and commerce. Brian has been with the agency for the past 2 years and is based out of Atlanta, GA.

items.title: Winslow Porter
items.content: Winslow Porter is an award-winning director, producer and creative technologist specializing in virtual/augmented reality as well as large-scale immersive installations. Winslow formed the pioneering, new media studio the New Reality Company in 2016, creating the critically-acclaimed cinematic VR experiences Giant and Tree. Shortly after, he was named Adweek’s Top 100 creatives as digital innovators and a designer-in-residence at A/D/O. In 2018, Tree won the Lumiere for Best Location Based VR Short as well as 7 other notable awards after being shown at over 100 notable conferences and festivals such as TED, UN General Assembly, Davos and Gardens By The Bay. He is currently a Cultural Leader at the World Economic Forum, a mentor in residence at the New Museum Incubator, an adjunct NYU Tisch professor, a founding member of the Onassis Institute’s ONX art/tech accelerator, as well as a creative director and creative tech consultant at R/GA Global. Winslow’s new immersive AR experience Rainforest, which received an Epic Games MegaGrant, transforms participant’s settings into their own private jungle environment to elucidate pressing concepts and concerns of sustainability and conservation. Winslow is also an artist in residence at the Smallhold Mushroom farm in Brooklyn, creating Forager, an immersive experience of the life-cycle of a mushroom, featuring the first volumetric time-lapse inside a game engine.

items.title: Amanda Pool
items.content:
Amanda’s recent endeavors have lead her to join forces with the Web3 powerhouse DAO, XLA, as Director of Events and lead in experiential marketing. XLA’s mission is to democratize wealth building and revenue distribution for IP creators, owners, and holders by empowering them through the power of Web 3.0 based technologies.

She is the visionary behind 150+ innovative technological events of the past decade, providing the leading curated event platforms for groundbreaking artists, film, immersive media, blockchain technologies, space exploration, motion capture innovation, and other emerging technologies now converging and evolving to create experiences and brands into the metaverse.

Amanda Pool is the Founder of Imagine Global Marketing and Imagine Events Services, producing and executing over 150 individual events in technology, film and music over the last 5+ years. Imagine was Agency of Record for the IBC Convention, Europe’s largest media trade show (curating the schedule for the Future Reality Zone); Agency of Record for the Advanced Imaging Society (producing and curating “On the Lot” at Paramount Studios for three consecutive years). Imagine also produced Eveleigh Social House, VR On the Mountain, and The Fly Lounge at Sundance Film Festival and the Lumiere Awards. She has produced events at Coachella, EDC, NAB, CES, Toronto International Film Festival, Festival de Cannes, and many more.

items.title: Becoming Metaverse Ready
items.content: When people are still talking about what the Metaverse is, it can be confusing for Brands to know what to do to start thinking about their brands spatially. This session will provide some sense making from the day to build your Metaverse.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Case Study: Hilti’s 3D Brand Guidelines Experience
items.content: How Hilti is using 3D to communicate visual identity guidelines using MetaVRse Engine.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Benno Erhardt
items.content:
Today I lead storytelling and digital design within the challenging demands of a sales organization, while advising brand managers and brand design representatives globally on campaign execution excellence, be it via internal workforce or external agencies alike.

Growing up in Switzerland in a trilingual household, I learned about ideating, developing and executing on creative and social selling at a very young age. It’s what drives me of being a business driven, passionate and flexible solution leader today. I love to brainstorm with my team, as well as engage management in any group-wide, fast moving environment, often beyond borders and continents.

It’s what drove me to study in Los Angeles at the ArtCenter College of Design, after which I ended up spending 10 years on the West Coast to help my clients and employers excel in brand strategy, design evolution and concept development. Be it independent compilations of research, trend studies, market analysis or any design related concept development and design system, I love presenting strategic plans to executive boards as well as getting my peers fired up for it.

Innovation is my passion. I love to fuel creativity and brainstorm ideas. I enjoy abstract analysis and discover new ways to foster solutions. I thrive on blazing fresh trails, come up with the most viable product for the challenges at hand and then convince leaders to boldly move forward.

items.title: Case Study: MeetKai Metaverse
items.content: MeetKai is a conversational AI company that delivers WebXR and Blockchain integrated experiences. James Kaplan joins Sophia to talk about their vision for Web3.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: James Kaplan
items.content:
James Kaplan is the Co-Founder and CEO of MeetKai Inc., a Conversational AI and metaverse company shaping the next-gen of artificial speech intelligence. He founded the startup with Co-Founder and Chairwoman, Weili Dai, after becoming frustrated with the limitations of current automated assistants. Kaplan has had a true passion for AI and coding since he was six and wrote his first bots at only nine years old, including the first Pokemon Go bot and many others still popular to this day.

Now his pioneering work puts MeetKai in competition with the largest names in tech. MeetKai Inc. was listed by Forbes as a “Tech Company Leading the Way” and has powered AI solutions for more than 20M people around the world. Kaplan studied Computer Science at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, CA and currently resides in the Los Angeles area.

items.title: WebXR Design Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Design Summit was hosted by Kent Bye on October 12, 2021. It introduces applications of spatial computing to interactive storytelling and the user design experience. 


The world’s WebXR experts, 3D designers, and marketers share design principles and best practices for immersive technologies. In order to reap the benefits of WebXR, professionals need to know how to create content for the medium, and the Design Summit will show the way. 


Spatial design is still new. Attendees at the summit will learn key tools, design considerations for 3D, and spatial thinking. Attendees will hear about WebXR success stories, common pitfalls to avoid, and design tips

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Chris Duffey
items.content:
Chris Duffey spearheads Adobe’s Creative Cloud strategic development experience design partnerships across the creative enterprise space. Chris’ keynotes have received over 50 million impressions. His sessions have been reported around the world including Access Hollywood, Extra, Ok Magazine, Hello, People, and The Guardian. In addition, his work has been featured by more than 100 global media outlets on topics including generative experience design, computational creativity, the role of human and machine and AI enhanced creativity.

Prior to Adobe, Chris was an Executive Creative Director having been a creative consultant with over 35 advertising agencies across the major global holding companies: WPP, IPG, Havas, Omnicom, Publicis and MDC.

Chris also serves on The Board of Directors for the Association of National Advertisers NY (ANA) and The Consumer Technology Association (CTA) Board of Industry Leaders.

Chris is author of the award-winning book Superhuman Innovation, the world’s first book co-authored by AI about AI.

items.title: Passion and Purpose – The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration
Jacquelyn Morie
items.content:
Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

items.title: Modeling Your Metaverse
items.content: The opportunity to create realities that aren’t modeled on what’s familiar or possible lies In a network of worlds where time and physics don’t apply.  Imagination becomes your superpower, unbound by conventional thinking

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Christi Fenison
items.content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

items.title: Artsy Marie
items.content:
I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

items.title: Juliana Loh
items.content: Juliana Loh is a Creative Producer working hard to change the world by bringing imagination, critical thinking and a sense of play + wonder to the forefront. Drawn to global perspectives, she identifies with the storytellers, futurists and game changers in a world in need of a better vision. A talented XR artist (Google Tiltbrush) and in-world designer, Juliana uses human centric design thinking to give structure, inspiration and meaning to ideas, people and places. Her work has been represented at four International Film Festivals and she has spoken at such venues as SXSW and various XR global summits.

items.title: Why 6DoF Matters
items.content: When moving around in Virtual Worlds and around holograms projected in the real world, you are the camera, and sensors determine your proximity to virtual objects and your ability to interact with them. Understanding these functions is important.

items.title: Chris Madsen
items.content:
Chris worked 20 years in behavioral health administration and programming before experiencing social presence via VR in 2013. VR changed his professional trajectory when he recognized the disruptive implications remote, immersive, shared experiences, unbound from the physical restraints and proximity requirements of the real world, will have on the way humans work, learn, and socialize.

Listed by Onalytica as a Top 100 influencer in both AR and VR, Chris is particularly noted for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of the XR movement.

Chris has held a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for the leading Virtual Reality tech blog ‘Road to VR’, co-founder of Utah VR and Silicon Slopes (AR/VR chapter), Edge of Discovery Ambassador, Siggraph judge, XR consultant/speaker, and Director of AR/VR at Morph 3D where he co-developed portable and persistent avatar systems.

Chris is currently serving as Senior Sales Engineer for ENGAGE XR, delivering virtual collaboration, communication, training, education, events and creative solutions to a growing global market transitioning to the metaverse

items.title: Alex Harvey
items.content:
Alex spent 10 years in the games industry with Codemasters before starting RiVR in 2015.

We started making 360 videos for car manufacturers and holiday brands all around the world which led us to create some software to synchronise all the virtual reality headset together. RiVR link is the software that came out of those projects and is now being used all over the world for training in all industries particularly first responders.

RiVR has also created photo realistic fire and crime scene investigation scenarios (RiVR investigate) for UK and US governments and we now see the software being used in multiple sectors.

as we look to the future we are growing our scanning techniques and pipelines allowing us to create two-dimensional documentary series which incorporates 6° of freedom photorealistic room scale virtual reality as well!

Step inside is the new platform we are creating to allow people to go that next step with a documentary film or TV series.

items.title: James Jensen
items.content:
James Jensen is an entrepreneur committed to working with leading-edge technology and eager to solve
problems surrounding how we interact and engage with each other in physical and virtual worlds. He is
the previous creator and co-founder of the world-renowned virtual reality company The VOID. Within
the last 25 years, James founded and managed several technology companies in video streaming, social
networks, mobile games, and creative services. He has partnered with Disney, Sony Entertainment, FOX,
MGM, Intel, Microsoft, SyFy, Dreamworks, and MTV through those ventures.

He is now launching a new form of virtual reality, called hyper reality, in the form of the multi-sensory
entertainment company JUMP. JUMP will allow people to come as close to jumping and flying as the
real thing, but without all of the risk.

items.title: Andreea Ion Cojocaru
items.content: Andreea Ion Cojocaru is a licensed architect, a software developer, and the co-founder of NUMENA, a company comprised of coding architects that both design and develop. Projects focus on spatial experiences and interactions across multiple dimensions and modalities.

items.title: Beyond the Uncanny Valley – Likeable Avatars and Metahumans
items.content: Between cartoons and photorealism lies the ”Uncanny Valley“ where people get creeped-out by faux-to realistic images that fail to do a good job of representing living creatures. What does and doesn’t make us feel comfortable around avatars?

items.title: Christina “Xaos Princess” Kinne
items.content:
Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

items.title: Danny Stefanic
items.content:
Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\'s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup.

Called a "visionary" by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be "one of the pioneers in his field", he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

items.title: Paige Dansinger
items.content: Paige Dansinger is the founder of Better World Museum, Horizon Art Museum, Women in Horizon, and is a Facebook Horizon VR Game Developer. Paige is recognized by Facebook as one of the Top 117 Global Community Leaders by the Facebook Community Leadership Fellowship Program. Paige has presented at the WHO, TEDx, Facebook’s Global Wellness & Safety Summit, Nobel Peace Prize, Singapore, Shenzhen, Beijing, Miami, San Francisco, and more.

items.title: Jin
items.content: Lifelong passion for decentralized and p2p technology. I\'ve been in VR since DK1 was released and building web based VR experiences for 7 years. I\'m interested in the standards and file formats that become the glue for the next version of the internet. Everyday I think about how the metaverse can be less friction and more freedom.

items.title: Marketing Makeovers -Adapting Your Brand for the 3D Web
items.content: It’s not just adding a z-axis. When the immersive Web becomes ubiquitous, your existing branding will fall flat, literally. The time to start adapting and experimenting is now, before your next-gen content is in front of an audience of millions with high expectations.

items.title: Nisha Burton
items.content:
As the CMO and Co-Founder of Reflective Brands, Nisha has a robust collection of skills pertaining to the media industry, digital marketing, and branding. Nisha specializes in helping companies elevate their brand identity and accomplish their goals through custom immersive experiences using VR/AR, strategic branding, and transmedia marketing. She is also a skilled filmmaker and currently she serves on the executive board of the OMPA the top trade organization for media production professionals in Oregon.

With over 15 years of experience in this field, Nisha brings expertise in utilizing the power of storytelling and cutting-edge technologies to get exceptional marketing results.

items.title: James Watson
items.content:
James is a marketing expert in the immersive technology sector, with extensive experience in marketing VR and AR solutions stretching back to the launch of the first Oculus headset in 2013.

He is currently  Chief Marketing Officer at The Glimpse Group (Nasdaq: VRAR), a multi-solution immersive technology company with an ecosystem of 13 subsidiary companies. Previously he founded XRTech Marketing consultancy and was CMO at VR platform provider Immerse.

items.title: Catherine Henry
items.content:
Catherine D. Henry is a leading voice in XR and one of the top women covering augmented reality, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence –– combining futurism with creative technology and strategic implementation.

Catherine is SVP Growth at Media.Monks, where she advises leading global brands on how to enter the Metaverse; a new era of brand virtualization with innovative ideas and cutting edge technology, from enterprise to entertainment. Catherine decodes technology and interactive experiences to help companies become more resilient, efficient, and productive.

With a career spanning nearly 20 years in global financial services leading institutional sales for private and equity tech investments, Catherine enables teams to better communicate, collaborate and create with tech –– no matter where they are.

Catherine D. Henry is a Black female tech geek & AfroFuturist who holds an MBA, MA in economics, and speaks five languages. She did post-graduate work in immersive media & VR Film making at NY Film Academy (2016).

items.title: Shreya Bansal
items.content:
A creative enthusiast, inquisitive, fuelled by unwavering enthusiasm, I desire to build enriching & interactive experiences. My hobby of learning and exploring newer formats of experience led me to become an XR Experience Designer and finish my 2 year masters degree in Immersive Media Design.

I believe, \"The mind, once stretched by a new idea, never returns to its original dimensions.” ― Ralph Waldo Emerson

items.title: Alan Smithson – MetaVRse Engine
items.content: MetaVRse is a code-optional platform that makes it easy to create & share interactive 3D experiences instantly on the web.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Designing Accessible Interactions for the Immersive Web
John Akers
items.content:
John Akers is the Director of Research and Education at the University of Washington Reality Lab where he manages the XR-related undergraduate research program and educational initiatives. He received bachelor\'s and master\'s degrees in Computer Science and Informatics from the University of Washington, where he researched approaches for accessible input devices for XR applications in the Taskar Center for Accessible Technology.

He is also a member of the XR Access Initiative and a participant of prior W3C workshops on inclusive design for immersive web standards.

items.title: Matt Cool
items.content: Matt is a web developer interested in 3d design, Blender and creating a more open web where we can contribute to more accessible experiences and solutions.

items.title: Designing for multiple input types across devices
items.content: Now that we’ve reinvented the menu, let’s talk about managing the user’s journey from legacy keyboard and mouse input, to touch screens to controllers, hand tracking, gaze pointers, rings and gesture recognition for a wholistic look at next-gen user interfaces.

items.title: Alina Kadlubsky
items.content: Alina is an Art Director Design Researcher, WebXR Developer; Director of Communications of the Open AR Cloud Association and Managing Director of Open AR Cloud Europe gUG as well as Lead Strategist of the Cyber XR Coalition. With a passion for immersive Tech, Spatial Computing, Spatial Web and creating a human centered future of Computing.

items.title: Michael Posso
items.content:
A JavaScript full-stack developer with over 10 years of expertise in creating enterprise on-line experiences. My methodology of development is based on writing maintainable code with a DevOps first mindset. My formal art & design training taught me to carefully consider my audience and create designs and applications that bring value to the user.

In addition to web development, the advent of virtual reality has opened new frontiers in the areas of coding and user interfaces for immersive applications. Moreover, as an avid learner, I have taught workshops and courses in person and on-line at colleges and universities.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Yinch Yeap
items.content:
Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre. His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks. Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

items.title: Everything will be Gamified
items.content: Interactivity is the key to unlocking Spatial Memory, and Immersive Websites transition us from passive consumption to active participation. Through doing we become experienced, increasing retention. This is why we call them experiences.

items.title: Dominique Wu
items.content: Dominique Wu is a senior UX/UI Designer, AR/VR Designer, and Art Director specializing in the entertainment and tech industries. She has designed and developed strategies to help businesses scale sustainably and maximize growth for more than 10 years.

items.title: James Ashley
items.content:
James is currently CTO at LABLIGHTAR.

He co-authored the popular LinkedIn Learning video course HoloLens App Development. He also wrote the technical book Beginning Kinect Programming with the Microsoft Kinect SDK.

In a previous life, he pursued a PhD in Philosophy at Emory University, with a focus on theories of consciousness and phenomenology.

items.title: Jeremie Lasnier
items.content:
After completing his Master\'s degree in Media Design at HEAD in Geneva and being a researcher in Interaction Design at ENSAD in Paris; Jérémie Lasnier co-founded LiveLike to build immersive sports streaming experiences in VR, mobile, and web, endorsed both by the NFL and TechCrunch. As Chief Creative Officer, He pushed the boundaries of innovation by overseeing all aspects of the design from implementing interfaces, 3D environments to mixed reality augmentations. He worked with major TV channels such as Fox Sports, France TV, and SKY to broadcast the biggest events of the world like the World Cup, the Superbowl, and the final of the Champion\'s League.


Jérémie won multiple international awards such as a Samsung Design Award, VR Award, and a Gold Award at the Oculus Mobile VR Jam. He also joined the prestigious 30 under 30 Forbes List class of 2017.
In 2020, LiveLike\'s VR product got acquired by Cosm, a global company focused on design, technology, and innovation to deliver the best immersive experiences to partners around the world. Jérémie joined the leadership team as VP, Immersive Design.

items.title: Bryan Mehr
items.content: Started in Business in the Print Industry and always had an interest in different tech to compliment the print work we did. Got in to Augmented reality many years back now, which led me to learn how to actually develop it. I\'ve since worked as a developer and in several other capacities in the industry and am excited by the endless opportunities to be creative.

items.title: Art and Educational Space
items.content: This session introduces the on-going VR Art and Design coursework of Dr. Steve Guynup. It is a live VR demo with a VR audience, broadcast from Dr. Guynup's FrameVR class space. Teaching methods, creative use of space, and leveraging of virtual art and virtual poetry as inspiration for educational projects are explored. Participants will learn to look at their own works through a lens of virtual art and discover new options for crafting engaging educational outcomes.

items.title: Steve Guynup
items.content:
Dr. Guynup is an award winning VR artist, author, and teacher. As an artist, his exploration of storytelling / shape changing avatars and use of poetry to unpack the design language of VR in the 1990's continues to resonate today. As a professional, he built multi-million dollar training software for for CSX Rail, Weyehauser, UPS, and more. For the past decade he's taught online, in-world, multi-user, classes on VR art and design.

Dr. Guynup currently teaches at Southern New Hampshire University and is developing VR classes there.

items.title: Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg
items.content:
Space Popular is directed by Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg, both alumni of the Architectural Association in London (2011). They founded the practice in Bangkok (2013) and have been based in London since 2016. Space Popular creates spaces, objects, and events in both physical and virtual space, concentrating on how the two realms can blend together.

The studio has completed buildings, exhibitions, public artworks, furniture collections, and interiors across Asia and Europe, as well as virtual architecture for the immersive internet. Clients, collaborators, and commissioners include national institutions such as MAXXI - National Museum of 21st Century Art, Rome, Italy; The Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design –ArkDes, Stockholm, Sweden; Royal Institute of British Architects, London, UK; National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Seoul, South Korea; as well as independent galleries such as MAGAZIN, Vienna, Austria; and Sto Werkstatt, London, UK.

Lesmes and Hellberg both have extensive academic experience having taught architectural design studio since 2011, first at INDA, Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, since 2016 at the Architectural Association in London, and since 2020 at Daniels, Faculty of Architecture, University of Toronto. Their current MArch design and research studio at Daniels investigates visions for civic architecture in the immersive internet.

items.title: Lighting and Textures
items.content: The secret to compelling and beautiful experiences is in applying properties to objects that reflect color and provide detail, while being mindful of processing overhead. Here we reveal the tricks that pros use to produce highly performant wow factor.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.

items.title: Zachary Capalbo
items.content: Zach Capalbo (he/him) has been dabbling with WebXR for a few years in the form of his experimental VR art creation app VARTISTE and related hobby projects.

items.title: Kitae Kim
items.content:
Kitae Kim is a Co-Founder of NYC creative studio, Third Axis, building XR content and technology. Originally trained in architecture, Kitae Kim had spent his time prior to Third Axis designing large-scale interactive art installations for acclaimed media artist, Rafael Lozano-Hemmer, using 3D tools like; Rhino, Grasshopper, Blender, Touchdesigner, Houdini and Unreal Engine.

He is now applying that 3D, parametric and real-time design knowledge to WebXR through Third Axis.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Conversation with Robin Hunicke and Doug North Cook
Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality.
