He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Robin Hunicke
items.content: Robin Hunicke is the CEO and co-founder of Funomena, an experimental game company working in AR, VR and traditional console & PC gaming. Focused on pushing the boundaries of gameplay and connection through new platforms, Robin is most well known for her work on Journey, The Sims, Luna and Wattam. She is also a full professor of Game Design at UC Santa Cruz, in the department of Performance, Play and Design.

items.title: Doug North Cook
items.content: Doug North Cook is an artist, professor, and researcher focused on immersive technology, interaction design, and the application of architectural theory to digital environments. He founded the Immersive Media programs at Chatham University, and runs the Immersive Design & Game Design Residencies at Fallingwater. Doug is currently working on multiple new projects including museum installations, game projects, and scientific research.

items.title: Caitlin Krause
items.content:
Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide.

Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

items.title: Polygons are the New “Expensive” – Optimizing for Scalability
items.content: Realism comes at a cost measured in framerates. Striking the balance between quality and performance while creating content-rich compelling experiences with that people want to enjoy and share with others is key.

items.title: Austin Caine
items.content:
Austin Caine, a.k.a Cause, is a professional world designer specializing in building bespoke 3D event spaces for social VR platforms. He is a prominent builder in AltspaceVR having created some of the more popular entertainment spaces (such as The Flying Saucer and The Worm Hole) and has helped to spark innovation in many other creators.

He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual "Burning Man" event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. These days he and his partner Christi work closely together on many VR and XR projects to deliver clients a higher level of atmospheric quality while maintaining optimal download speeds and visual framerates.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.

items.title: Will Cherry
items.content:
WILL CHERRY is a director, designer, and technologist specializing in the combination of hemorrhaging-edge technology with story-driven interaction design. His career creating 360 and realtime VR/AR experiences for companies like Samsung, AT&T, Apple, and more stem from a love of human-centered immersive design principles. A Swiss-army-knife of a person, his technical skillset spans AAA game and film production disciplines to drive creative solutions for any medium.

His unending passion: using technology to both create art and improve the human condition through experience - be it digital, physical, or the juxtaposition of the two.

items.title: Immersive Video – Volumetric,  360°, and Parallax
items.content: Not all 3D Formats are created equal, and each have their own technical benefits and limitations. It is essential to understand the value of each and to choose which media type best serves the experience you are designing for.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Christina Heller
items.content:
Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology.

Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\'s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene.

Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

items.title: Hugh Hou
items.content:
Hugh Hou is a Co-Founder and Creative Director for CreatorUp, a digital media education company and production studio. He heads up immersive media content creation and has produced VR content for numerous companies and organizations such as Samsung, the Special Olympics, Google, Oculus, MasterCard, Twitter, TikTok, RedBull Music, LACOSTE, Huawei, and the Los Angeles Police Department.
He also directs and produces Mixed Reality music videos. He worked with musical artists such as I Prevail, Joyner Lucas, Kristina Sky, Roger Shah, Cypress Hill, and SHAED.

When not producing original VR videos & films, Hugh dedicates his time to sharing his vast expertise in immersive technologies and VR filmmaking on the CreatorUp YouTube channel. He truly believes that by sharing freely with the world through YouTube, mentoring and consulting, more creators will join the immersive media family.
Hugh’s goal is to help the VR industry thrive and to improve the quality of VR filmmaking.

items.title: Shawn Frayne
items.content:
Inspired by movies in the 80’s and 90’s, Shawn has been reaching towards the dream of the hologram for over 20 years. Shawn got his start with a classic laser interference pattern holographic studio he built in high school, followed by training in advanced holographic film techniques at MIT. He has been awarded dozens of patents around the world, the Popular Mechanics Breakthrough Award, and noted as one of the ‘20 Best Brains Under 40’ by Discover Magazine.

Shawn works between Brooklyn and Hong Kong where he serves as co-founder and CEO of Looking Glass Factory.

items.title: Designing for the Bigger Picture
items.content: From 2D to 3D to Immersive across all display types.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Ayşegül Yönet
items.content: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.

items.title: Michael DiBenigno
items.content:
Story without data is an antidote, data without a story lacks empathy, but a data story can spark a movement. Michael is a data storyteller with a 100k following on TikTok as @the.data.guy

He is also a co-founder of Flow Immersive which is a data storytelling platform for authoring and presenting data stories.

Prior to Flow, Michael was a manager in the Strategy practice at Deloitte Consulting.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: WebXR Developer Summit
items.content: The WebXR Developer Summit Hosted by Trevor Flowers was the first event of the WebXR Summit Series. It was inspired by acceptance speeches from The 1st Polys - WebXR Awards and was held on May 25, 2021, convening pioneers and leaders in WebXR and the XR Industry. It's focus on coding for WebXR enlightened many to the possibilities and methods of delivering of XR content delivered to browsers. This event inspired the WebXR Summits that followed it and stands as a milestone in bringing awareness of the possibilities of WebXR to the Community.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Ricardo Cabello – Mr. Doob
items.content:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

items.title: WebXR Unity Exporter
items.content:
Current state of WebXR in Unity

A showcase of experiences.

  • - What is currently possible/supported.
  • - What is planned next.
  • - Good use cases for the current state of the extension

items.title: Oren De-Panther Weizman
items.content:
Oren (De-Panther) Weizman, is a VR/AR developer that loves to experiment with new tech.
He is a Co-Admin at the Israeli Unity Developers group.
Co-Founder at Total-Viz, where he develops XR games.

A Software Developer at Resonai, where he is part of the team that works on Vera, an AR platform that transforms physical spaces into intelligent digital environments.
In his spare time, he works on WebXR Export, a Unity XR package that allows developers to build WebXR experiences using Unity.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Will Eastcott
items.content:
Will Eastcott is the creator of PlayCanvas, the online collaborative game engine built on WebGL and WebXR. Will has been building AAA games and engines since 1997, holding senior positions at EA, Sony and Activision.

He also holds an Individual Contributor membership with the Khronos Group and is extremely active in the WebGL and glTF ecosystems. He's a quintessential Englishman who loves to drink tea and complain about the weather.

items.title: Stewart Smith
items.content: I’m a lucky guy—I get paid to invent fun things. Currently, I work for Amazon as a global consultant on virtual reality and spatial computing. On the weekends I maintain Q, a browser-based quantum circuit simulation framework.

items.title: Jonathan Hale
items.content: Co-host of the Vhite Rabbit WebXR podcast and one of the original founders of the VR browser games platform \"Construct Arcade\", where he realized the need for WebXR focused development tools, which lead to the inception of Wonderland Engine, a development platform for VR, AR and 3D on the web.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010. He is currently Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Corentin Wallez
items.content: Currently leading the WebGPU efforts on the Chromium side and chair of the WebGPU W3C group.

items.title: WebXR Hit Test in MetaVRse Engine
Walid Abdelaty
items.content:
Co-Founder & CTO of Metavrse
Former Co-Founder and CTO of Cherry3D
Life Long Developer

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010. He is currently Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Jacob Rossi
items.content: Jacob is the Product Manager for the web platform at Oculus, leading the product development of Oculus Browser, WebXR, and Progressive Web Apps for all of Oculus's VR devices. Jacob has helping develop browsers, web standards, and developer tools at Microsoft, the W3C, and Oculus for over 12 years.

items.title: Lisi Linares
items.content:
LISI LINARES is the founder of LNRS PR+ XR TLNT MNGMNT, a boutique publicity and talent management agency that operates in stealth mode. All of the clients come word of mouth.

VR has been Lisi’s passion since she wrote her first VR script at NYU Film in 1994. Too early to start a career in VR, Lisi began making music. She recorded and released songs with influential label, Ze Records. Her music attracted the casting agent for SURVIVOR. She went on to appear as a castaway on season 14. Doing press junkets for CBS lead to a pointing point. “I really got into how a story is pitched and how the narrative of a character is shaped in the media”

In 2015, Lisi co-founded a public relations agency representing primarily Crypto and Blockchain projects. After premiering the first Anime on the blockchain, Vevara in Your Dream and working with some of the bigger projects in the space such as David Chaum’s Elixxir, Path Network and NGRAVE, it was time to move on.
During the summer of 2019 Lisi saw an opportunity to pivot into VR, the great love of her life! Starting with consulting AR start-ups, she quickly became immersed in the XR community. “I feel like I had found my tribe.”

March 2021, Lisi expanded her publicity services to include managing xr talent. She is actively bridging the gap between 20th and 21st century entertainment. Consulting talent agencies on how to prepare their talent roster was the inspiration behind XR TLNT MNGMNT.
Lisi is a proud Board Member of the Femme Futures Grant at Artizen and XR Women.

Stay tuned more to come...

items.title: Jono Brandel
items.content:
Jonathan (Jono) Brandel is an award winning graphic designer and computer programmer. He comes from mixed heritage, an American of Filipino and Polish descent. As such Jono pairs distinct subjects to frame the creative process. These combinations range from latin and emojis to lithography and pixel sorting. While pairings vary, there is an accessible tenor to the digital and physical objects he produces. This attention to detail allows people to access complex subject matters including positivism, the collision of black holes, and music composition with ease.

With a Bachelor’s in Design | Media Arts, a Minor in Latin from the University of California, Los Angeles, and a Master of Fine Arts in New Media from Paris College of Art, Jono’s work has been shown at international festivals including TED, Sundance, Tribeca Film Festival, SIGGRAPH, and the Japan Media Arts Festival. His commitment to Visual Music has sparked collaborations with musicians including applications with Lullatone, a live performance with Nosaj Thing, and interactive music videos for the likes of Matthew Dear, the Chemical Brothers, and Kimbra.
To develop his projects Jono writes custom software and actively participates in open source communities. He shares his own libraries such as the event driven two-dimensional drawing interface for the web, Two.js. This library and many others are freely available and actively maintained to help promote the creative expression of individuals worldwide.

items.title: Brendan Bradley
items.content:
Brendan Andolsek Bradley is a multi-award winning actor, writer, director and producer known internationally as "America's Scrappy Storyteller" (AR Post) with 100+ IMDb credits, 50M+ views online and a leader in the virtual theater movement performing using groundbreaking XR/VR tools.

Brendan established The Integrative Technology Lab at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts to foster the next generation of multi-disciplinary live storytellers and during the pandemic, he began releasing free tutorials and case-studies for adopting ubiquitous streaming tools for live performance, including a customizable virtual theater in your web browser that allows anyone in the world to get back "on" stage for free. More at brendanAbradley.com/futurestages

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Kai Frazier
items.content:
Kai Frazier is an educator turned EdTech entrepreneur passionate about using tech to provide opportunities for underestimated communities.

She is the founder & CEO of Kai XR, which uses Metaverse technologies to develop critical 21st century skills in students preparing them for a rapidly evolving future. Kai also serves as Global Child Safety & Education Adviser for the XR Safety Initiative, XRSI.

Before creating Kai XR, she worked with several museums such as the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum as well as the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History & Culture, specializing in digital strategy and content creation.
Her company is backed by Techstars & T-Mobile and has been featured in Forbes, NBC, the Steve Harvey Show & more.

items.title: Blair MacIntyre
items.content:
Blair MacIntyre is a Professor of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech, where he has explored socio-technical issues surrounding AR and VR for more than 20 years. He has built authoring toolkits for media designers, deployed room-scale and handheld games and experiences, built AR-enabled web-browsers, helped lead the design of WebXR, and run online conferences using immersive social VR.

His experience spans all aspects of building, deploying, and evaluating AR and VR tools, systems, and experiences. He has been doing research in augmented reality since 1991, is actively involved with numerous conferences and workshops, speaks and consults regularly, and has published over 100 academic papers in the field.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Brian Peiris
items.content:
Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community.

Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

items.title: Elgin-Skye McLaren
items.content:
Elgin-Skye McLaren is a Senior Product Manager for Mozilla Hubs - an open source platform for creating and sharing 3D social spaces on the web.

She holds an MSc in Interactive Arts and Technology from Simon Fraser University. When she isn't working on Hubs or exploring VR she enjoys roller skating and building cool stuff with code.

items.title: James Baicoianu
items.content: Exploring the possibilities of the web

items.title: Liam Broza
items.content:
Liam Broza is the creator of LifeScope.io and Laguna Labs. LifeScope is an Open Source AI assisted personal database for private real time data collection.

Laguna Labs created XREngine; an immersive social experience that is delivered through just your internet browser. Anyone can create virtual spaces and events with approachable open source tools.

items.title: Clayton Banks
items.content:
Tedx and Global speaker. Experienced Executive with strong leadership and strategic skills. Recently recognized as the 2013 "Business Person of the Year" by the Harlem Business Alliance for implementing innovative strategies for non-profit and for profit clients and exceeding objectives.

Skilled in content, technology, brand development, multimedia, online web and multiplatform production, for domestic and international operations. A track record of positive results in P&L management, multi-channel distribution, product launches, new market recognition, and growing the bottom-line while motivating an accomplished staff in a dynamic business environment.

items.title: Raanan Weber
items.content:
Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js - the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. For the last year he has been working as a software developer @ Microsoft in the Babylon.js team. A major part of his time is invested in developing and maintaining Babylon's WebXR support. The rest of the time he is trying to configure build systems, fight React, and catch up on E-Mails.

He resides in Berlin, Germany, and enjoys playing multiplayer games with his family, making music, and practicing magic tricks that get him nowhere.

items.title: Oculus Browser and the Immersive Web
Dave Hill
items.content:
Hi, I'm Dave Hill. I'm an Engineering Manager at Oculus/Facebook Reality Labs, supporting the Oculus Browser team and focusing on the web developer ecosystem as it relates to our headsets and our browser. Prior to joining Oculus, I spent time at Microsoft working on HoloLens, and on Xbox Kinect before that.

Before that, I spent a bunch of years working in game development working on gameplay, graphics, and engine programming.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Diego Marcos Segura
items.content: A-Frame co-creator and main maintainer. I was part of the original team at Mozilla that kickstarted the WebVR standard.

items.title: Active Theory – Secret Sky and Dreamwave
Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Michael Anthony
items.content:
After a combined 20 years of studying and teaching foreign languages, Michael McDonald created Gold Lotus which aims to demonstrate how virtual reality can support the learning and teaching of foreign languages.

Recent projects include the launch of the Handy English VR vocabulary-building app, a 24-hour VR English lesson and cultural event to raise funds for the fight against Covid and programs in schools around the world aimed at raising awareness of how VR can be used to develop language skills and cultural awareness, with particular focus on students building their own webXR spaces to share their local cultural heritage in a unique VR exchange program. His most recent course in partnership with VictoryXR has just concluded on the ENGAGE VR platform - Public Speaking in a Multicultural World.

items.title: Nick Mountford
items.content: Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

items.title: WebXR Education Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Summit Series returns on July 21st when Dr. Karen Alexander hosts the WebXR Education Summit bringing together the leaders of immersive education for a day of knowledge sharing with co-host Julie Smithson.

Have a look a the stellar roster of presenters, panelists and special guests we already have registered, with more confirmed, so stay tuned for additional announcements!

items.title: Welcome to the WebXR Education Summit
items.content: Summits creator Ben Erwin welcomes the audience, looks ahead to the great lineup of speakers on immersive education, and introduces host Dr. Karen Alexander.
items.description: Ben Erwin introduces the great day ahead

items.title: Ben Erwin
items.content:
Championing XR Industry Advancement through Leadership, Collaboration, and Innovation

As the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, Ben Erwin has made a lasting impact on the XR industry by catalyzing awareness and engagement with the immersive web. With over three decades of experience as an internet frontiersman, he has been instrumental in advancing the industry through the recognition of its pioneers and providing advocacy platforms for thought leaders.

Ben's diverse background includes serving as a developer and executive for digital media agencies, where he created data-driven interactives for numerous major brands. In addition, he dedicated 13 years as a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, raising awareness for women and children in conflict areas worldwide.

A digital polymath, Ben's expertise spans marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. His experience in the browser wars led him to collaborate with XR industry leadership in producing the MetaTr@versal series of events. These gatherings galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Passionate about the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication in areas like civics, journalism, and education, Ben shines a light on innovators' good works to preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon it.

With a network of over 10,500 LinkedIn followers and 9,500 connections, Ben Erwin exemplifies dedication to the XR industry's growth, championing its advancement through leadership, collaboration, and innovation.

items.title: Opening Remarks
items.content: Dr. Karen Alexander sets the context and scope of presentations on Immersive Education and addresses the role of WebXR as an enabler for accelerated development of accessible XR programs.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Fireside Chat with Mina Johnson-Glenberg
items.content: Dr. Johnson-Glenberg shares insights from her research on learning and retention with XR and how that research informs experiences developed by her award-winning company, Embodied Games, and the rubric she has developed to help determine the pedagogical quality of lessons in virtual reality.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:

Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise.

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Mina Johnson-Glenberg
items.content:
Dr. Johnson-Glenberg is a Research Professor at Arizona State University in the Psychology department. She is also an entrepreneur and President of the award-winning learning technology company called Embodied Game, LLC. she leads a team that creates, researches, and disseminates innovative virtual and mixed reality (XR) educational content for 4th graders through life-long learners. Several of the NSF-funded STEM games can be downloaded for free at www.embodied-games.com.


She has a varied background as a screenwriter, experimental psychologist, and game designer. Her lab has been at the forefront of creating “embodied” and kinesthetically-active games using sensors and motion capture technologies for over a decade and a half. Dr. Johnson-Glenberg presents nationally and internationally. Some recent publications include design guidelines for learning VR at Frontiers in Robotics and AI and, a rubric that teachers can use to score the quality of a VR lesson.

items.title: The Metaversity Project
items.content: The Metaversity project led by Victory XR is a program of 10 Universities building digital twins in the Metaverse; Steve Grubbs shares with us the details of this pioneering initiative in an effort to inspire other schools to expand into immersive education.

items.title: Steve Grubbs
items.content: Steve Grubbs is the founder of VictoryXR, a pioneer in the space of metaversity education. Steve is the former chair of the House Education Committee in the Iowa Legislature and has degrees in business and law from the University of Iowa.

items.title: State of Immersive Learning with XR
items.content: The Immersive Learning Research Network annually convenes a panel of experts to produce the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. Leaders of this initiative discuss highlights of the 2022 report in progress.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel.
