Catherine D. Henry is a Black female tech geek & AfroFuturist who holds an MBA, MA in economics, and speaks five languages. She did post-graduate work in immersive media & VR Film making at NY Film Academy (2016).

items.title: Ricard Gras
items.content: Ricard works as CEO & co-founder at captic.io. Captic, the company behind vrland.io, has created a whitelabel metaverse solution for Web3. Ricard is Chair at SIGGRAPH Asia’s games program and founding member of Euromersive.

items.title: Daniel Ljunggren
items.content: Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

items.title: The Augmented Conversation
items.content: The Metaverse is and will be a powerful communication medium enabling users to express ideas and engage in ways that we can't quite fully imagine. Our ability to see, understand and control the world around us is about to take a quantum leap, but our ability to collaborate on and solve hard problems is even more crucial.

items.title: David A. Smith
items.content:
David Alan Smith Smith is the CTO and Founder of Croquet Corporation, developing the Croquet Microverse platform.
Smith is a computer scientist and entrepreneur who has focused on interactive 3D and using 3D as a basis for new user environments and entertainment. He built his first HMD in 1986 to study telepresence control of a remote robot arm using a Dataglove.
Smith was a Senior Fellow at Lockheed Martin, where he focused on next generation human centric computing and collaboration platforms. Before that, Smith was the chief architect of the Croquet Project, an open-source virtual world collaboration platform where he worked with Alan Kay (Turing Award) and David P Reed (created UDP, co-created TCP/IP) and Andreas Raab (Squeak Smalltalk co-developer).
In 1987, Smith created The Colony, the first real time 3D adventure game/shooter. Smith developed Virtus Walkthrough in 1990, the first real-time 3D design application for personal computers. Smith also co-founded Red Storm Entertainment with author Tom Clancy and co-created the Rainbow Six game franchise. David gave the keynote address at IEEE VR 2017.

items.title: Lucas Rizzotto – In The House
items.content: AR House Co-Founder Lucas Rizzotto is an Award Winning Creative, Futurist & Mad Scientist who creates exciting & surprisingly insightful tech projects that show us a glimpse of the future. From VR time machines to life-threatening alarm clocks, he entertains, inspires and educates through the joy of creating a future more like Star Trek and less like Black Mirror.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Lucas Rizzotto
items.content: Lucas Rizzotto is an award-winning VR/AR artist, filmmaker & community leader. Creator of the breakout Quest hit "Where Thoughts Go" as well as the viral series “Lucas Builds The Future”, Lucas’s work daringly pushes the boundaries of technology, storytelling & comedy all at once, creating innovative projects that warm the heart and open the mind of millions of people worldwide. Lucas is also the Co-Founder of the largest real-life community of Metaverse creators in the world, known as the AR House, and recently premiered his latest VR satire “Flat Earth VR” at the Sundance Film Festival.

items.title: Scaling WebXR with RP1
items.content: A conversation with CEO and Co-Founder of RP1, to discuss their technology that is maximizing how many users can concurrently enjoy an immersive experience with high frame rates.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Sean Mann
items.content: As CEO of RP1, Sean drives the overall strategic direction of the business, from vision, mission, sales, and go to market strategy. Sean has nearly 25 years of leadership, technology, and entrepreneurial experience in building companies from the ground up. His career experience spans multiple industries, having worked in various B2C and B2B companies, including medical, consumer electronics, software technology, fitness and wellness. He is a visionary leader with deep expertise in business transformation, strategic partnerships, and marketing strategies.

items.title: Democratizing WebXR
items.content: To make the Metaverse an inclusive place, it needs to be available at all. Here we explore what it will take to make immersive experiences available to all, and its potential as a platform for civic interaction.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Rolando Masís-Obando
items.content:
Rolando Masís-Obando is a PhD candidate of Computational Neuroscience at Princeton University. Scientifically, he is interested in how contexts (like those in VR/AR) shape the way we think and remember our day-to-day experiences. He has scanned dozens of people’s brains (and effectively read their minds) to further understand how the brain represents spaces and concepts. Given the intersection of AR/VR with neuroscience, Rolando’s recent interests revolve around how we can shape a future internet to be more human-centered and grounded under ethical principles. He recently directed a cinematic educational video on the history of the Metaverse and its ongoing issues with privacy and agency. The video can be found here: https://youtu.be/wsJF1ugsfKI

Rolando graduated from Yale University with a focus on Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology. During his studies co-founded Shuflix with his brothers, the largest activity search engine (at the time), to help people interact with their environment in a playful alternative way while helping small businesses get more exposure. Since then, he has also co-founded PhDx, a platform to help incoming PhD students with guides and insider knowledge of the unspoken rules in academia.

In his free time, Rolando is a filmmaker, composes for films, creates augmented reality tutorials for his YouTube channel, and does pro-bono marketing consulting for personal brands and small businesses.

items.title: Damon Hernandez
items.content:
Damon works in many areas of the Web3D & XR industries as a designer, developer, advisor, speaker, entrepreneur and executive that has been active in virtual environments, the 3D web, and other Metaverse related technologies for over 20 years. He is passionate about the web’s convergence with other technologies including 3D, IoT, GIS, CAD/BIM/CAM, AR/VR, mobile and advises a variety of entities that use these technologies for enterprise focused applications. Since 2007, he has been working closely with various built environment professions on the adoption and use of innovative technologies.

Previously he was at SIMLAB, where he was working to make property ownership & management more user friendly for owners via digital twins. At Samsung Research America he focused on making the web browser experience awesome and enhanced with immersive web technologies and new types of interfaces. He is a co-founder of IDEAbuilder, a high tech building company that uses immersive technologies and robotic manufacturing to build more efficiently. He has worked with 3D web and virtual world companies and was acting director of a student initiated organization with the Web3D Consortium, where he worked with the Consortium’s global outreach and education initiatives. He has built numerous mixed reality applications and has lead dozens of research projects in multiple domains.

As founding team member of the Augmented Reality Developer Camps, VR Hackathon, & founder of the AEC Hackathon, he is actively working to help grow the use of innovative technologies.

items.title: Mark Stephen Meadows
items.content: Meadows is an artist, author, and inventor. Since 2019 he has served as CTO for Idoru Worlds, guiding the development of tools to create, edit and place XR avatars. His professional interests include conversational portraits, interactive narratives, and natural language processing. With over twenty years in virtual reality, character design, artificial intelligence and over ten years in blockchain he has participated as a founder and advisor to startups and fortune-100s around the globe. As a 100-ton USCG captain Meadows has sailed four of the seven seas, speaks English, French, and Spanish and lives on his boat with his family in Mexico.

items.title: Fulfilling WebXR’s Potential
items.content: We are at the very beginning of an era where spatial content over the web will educate, entertain, and ultimately reach an audience of billions. It's time to examine what it will take to grow from early proofs of concepts to envision the Immersive Web of the next decade.

items.title: Haggai Goldfarb
items.content: Haggai Goldfarb, has held leadership positions with a distinguished track record of delivering successful large-scale projects and products to market. For over a decade he led VFX teams in Hollywood with significant roles at Warner Bros. Disney, DreamQuest and DreamWorks. Notable awards include: The recent prestigious Polys WebXR Awards 2021 with 3 wins for Experience of the year, Education experience of the year, and Video experience of the year for ‘The Magic of Flight’ XR experience, AIXR VR Awards 2021 nomination, DreamWorks Achievement Award, Kung-Fu Panda’s 2008 Academy Award Nomination for Best Animated Feature of the year, as well as winning the 36th Annual Annie Awards in 10 categories, including Best Animated Feature, ‘The High Ground Award’ strategy war games, between M.I.T Sloan Fellows and Harvard Business School, and has served as judge for the Animation Oscars. A visionary, inventor and a Metaverse pioneer, Haggai pursuit of the Metaverse and related Extended Reality (XR) and Enhanced Reality (ER) technologies (e.g 3D,VFX, AR,VR, MR) span over 20 years. At DreamWorks he managed key innovation, development and integration of the Academy award-winning "Shrek" facial system, adapting it to DreamWorks' animated features franchise pipeline. By enabling animators to convey emotions through facial expressions as never before, the Shrek facial system, was the breakthrough that allowed Shrek to be the first computer- animated film ever to put digital human characters in leading roles, leading it to become the highest- grossing animated franchise of all times, with over $3.5B in revenues. In 2006, Haggai launched a tech startup out of M.I.T focused on the innovation of the next generation natural human interface for the Metaverse. His innovation lab created key technologies and XR experiences that preceded commercial VR headsets including avatar interaction, head, facial and eye tracking, gestural and haptic. At Microsoft Haggai led Mixed Reality (MR) initiatives and R&D prototyping on HoloLens including the first shareable HoloLens Mixed Reality experience development at Microsoft which preceded “Mesh”. Most recently Haggai led XR strategy at Meta driving global XR initiatives, partnerships and teams in NA, APAC and EMEA. Notably, he produced and oversaw the creation and deployment for the first WebXR/OpenXR project, Project Origami: “The Magic of Flight”. As an innovation leader, he operates at the intersection of business, technology and creative. Haggai is an Alfred Sloan Fellow receiving his MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management.

items.title: Trent Clews-de Castella
items.content:
Trent is on a mission to pioneer immersive technology and transform human experience for good.

To achieve this, Trent believes in the power of storytelling and immersive technology to drive a new paradigm of change and climate action. Through emerging tools like VR, AR MR and WebXR, we can raise awareness for social and environmental impact causes like never before.

As the Co-founder and CEO at PHORIA, a Melbourne-based XR Studio, Trent and his team have been Emmy nominated for their previous work in WebXR with Meta and the International Paralympics Committee. Alongside working closely with respected partners and world leaders including Netflix, Google, WWF and the United Nations (UN).

items.title: Diego Marcos Segura
items.content: A-Frame co-creator and main maintainer. I was part of the original team at Mozilla that kickstarted the WebVR standard.

items.title: Tugce Joy
items.content: Tuğçe Joy majored in Psychology and then completed her masters in Cognitive Science, where she combined Psychology with Computer Engineering. She started working with Virtual and Augmented Reality as a lab assistant in 2015. Then she joined a startup and worked as a UX researcher for more than 2 years. She took part in many XR projects with different institutions and companies including but not limited to MIT Media Lab and Facebook Reality Labs. She published research papers in prestigious journals and conferences such as Virtual Reality Journal and CHI. Currently, she is working as a research assistant at Harvard University’s Learning, Innovation and Technology lab exploring the use of new immersive technologies in education.

items.title: From Ideation to Deployment
items.content: Get Ready for the sense making from today's conversation to digest what we learned at the WebXR Production Summit.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Key Takeaways from the WebXR Summit Series
items.content: The WebXR Summit Series Team looks back at what we learned from 6 events, 54 hours, and over 200 experts, and where we’re going with this thing we call the Metaverse.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Ben Erwin
items.content:
Championing XR Industry Advancement through Leadership, Collaboration, and Innovation

As the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, Ben Erwin has made a lasting impact on the XR industry by catalyzing awareness and engagement with the immersive web. With over three decades of experience as an internet frontiersman, he has been instrumental in advancing the industry through the recognition of its pioneers and providing advocacy platforms for thought leaders.

Ben's diverse background includes serving as a developer and executive for digital media agencies, where he created data-driven interactives for numerous major brands. In addition, he dedicated 13 years as a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, raising awareness for women and children in conflict areas worldwide.

A digital polymath, Ben's expertise spans marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. His experience in the browser wars led him to collaborate with XR industry leadership in producing the MetaTr@versal series of events. These gatherings galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Passionate about the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication in areas like civics, journalism, and education, Ben shines a light on innovators' good works to preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon it.

With a network of over 10,500 LinkedIn followers and 9,500 connections, Ben Erwin exemplifies dedication to the XR industry's growth, championing its advancement through leadership, collaboration, and innovation.

items.title: Ready Player Golf 3 – Benefitting Children’s Cancer Research Fund
Ready Player Golf 2 – Benefitting XRSI – The XR Safety Initiative
Ready Player Golf 2 – Golf Highlights Reel
Ready Player Golf – Benefitting MSF – Doctors without Borders
WebXR Developer Summit
items.content: The WebXR Developer Summit Hosted by Trevor Flowers was the first event of the WebXR Summit Series. It was inspired by acceptance speeches from The 1st Polys - WebXR Awards and was held on May 25, 2021, convening pioneers and leaders in WebXR and the XR Industry. It's focus on coding for WebXR enlightened many to the possibilities and methods of delivering of XR content delivered to browsers. This event inspired the WebXR Summits that followed it and stands as a milestone in bringing awareness of the possibilities of WebXR to the Community.

items.title: WebXR Business Summit
items.content:
Thank you for participating in the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews on September 14, 2021

Stay tuned for the launch of the individual videos, coming soon.

The summit featured WebXR business leaders and pioneers sharing their knowledge of and experience with immersive technologies, which are already producing ROI through work efficiencies, improved performances, and a sustainable global footprint. 

Perspectives include WebXR success stories, lessons learned, persona alignment, communication, and collaboration to ensure successful business outcomes.  

Galaxy Sponsor

We encourage you to join the community by coming to the watch parties hosted on SEVEN different platforms for this event! Thank you to all the people that helped make this possible.

items.title: WebXR Design Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Design Summit was hosted by Kent Bye on October 12, 2021. It introduces applications of spatial computing to interactive storytelling and the user design experience. 


The world’s WebXR experts, 3D designers, and marketers share design principles and best practices for immersive technologies. In order to reap the benefits of WebXR, professionals need to know how to create content for the medium, and the Design Summit will show the way. 


Spatial design is still new. Attendees at the summit will learn key tools, design considerations for 3D, and spatial thinking. Attendees will hear about WebXR success stories, common pitfalls to avoid, and design tips

items.title: WebXR Education Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Summit Series returns on July 21st when Dr. Karen Alexander hosts the WebXR Education Summit bringing together the leaders of immersive education for a day of knowledge sharing with co-host Julie Smithson.

Have a look a the stellar roster of presenters, panelists and special guests we already have registered, with more confirmed, so stay tuned for additional announcements!

items.title: WebXR Brand Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Brand Summit is an all-day virtual event with a long list of innovators who will share their insights on the paradigm shift of advertising in the immersive medium. Strategic discussions on a range of topics including Immersive AdTech, V-Commerce, Fashion and Luxury, Branded Events, Making your Brand Metaverse Ready, Intellectual Property, and more.

We're honored to be welcoming XR Innovation thought leaders including: Amy Peck, Tony Parisi, Alan Smithson, D.J. Smith, Kent Bye, Avi Bar-Zeev, Athena Demos, Anne-Marie Enns, Andy Fidel, Dulce Baerga, Valerie Vacante, Briar Prestidge, Veronica Costa Orvalho, Daniel Dyboski-Bryant, Karen Alexander, Gary Fearnall, Katitza Rodriguez Pereda, Aura Freeman, Vanitha Swaminathan, James Kaplan, Richard Ward, Jake Steinerman, Evan Gappelberg, Han Kim, Linda Ricci, Kiira, Benzing, Cynthia Maller, Bobby Carlton, Marco Cavalho, Celeste Lear, Benno K. Erhardt, Will Knecht, Ashley Crowder, Elijah Tai, Sonya Haskins Daria Fedko, Brian Hutchinson, Terry Proto, Samantha G. Wolfe, Tom Ffiske and more!

Register at https://bit.ly/WebXRBrandSummitTix for join info on where to watch and join our 5 VR Watch Parties in the Metaverse

items.title: WebXR Production Summit
items.content: The third and final installment of the 2022 WebXR Summit Series tackles all forms of XR production on October 13. From code frameworks and tools, to world building, to immersive media, to event production and everything you need to know about 'the how' of the Immersive Web. Host Daniel Dyboski-Bryant and co-host Julie Smithson bring you some of the best talent in the industry to share their expertise with you.

items.title: MetaTr@versal
items.content:
The MetaTr@versal Initiative is an independent advocacy fellowship that holds events designed to foster cooperation between the stakeholders of the Metaverse.

MetaTr@versal began in 2021 with a series of Zoom calls among industry leaders to express support for portal interoperablility across social XR platforms. This was followed up with a special 2-hour panel event, followed by a three-act play performed on the Main Stage at AWE in June of 2022. MetaTr@versal holds portal crawls between platforms to demonstrate the need for interoperability.

Founding Fellow Neil Trevett credits MetaTr@versal as being instrumental in the founding of the Metaverse Standards, which he chairs.

MetaTr@versal is created by Ben Erwin with founding Fellows Evo Heyning, Terry xR. Schussler, Neil Trevett, Daniel Dyboski-Bryant and Julie Smithson.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.content:

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Jason Marsh
items.content: Jason Marsh is the technical founder and CEO of Flow Immersive, a company focused on Data Storytelling with WebXR. Jason is obsessed with the brain science around how we can build better mental models of our data and information, understanding the limitations of slideware, and encoding better science into a product for anyone to build data presentations.

items.title: Michael DiBenigno
items.content:
Story without data is an antidote, data without a story lacks empathy, but a data story can spark a movement. Michael is a data storyteller with a 100k following on TikTok as @the.data.guy

He is also a co-founder of Flow Immersive which is a data storytelling platform for authoring and presenting data stories.

Prior to Flow, Michael was a manager in the Strategy practice at Deloitte Consulting.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Christina “Xaos Princess” Kinne
items.content:
Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Arome Ibrahim
items.content:
Arome Ibrahim is a passionate 360° Virtual Reality Developer, Product Manager (XR), Digital Media Arts Creator and Impact Entrepreneur who strongly believes in utilising technology, more broadly, innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He co-founded Experis Immersive - An Extended Reality (XR) content development agency creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative non-profit organisation that leverages Extended Reality (XR) technologies to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action toward the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Diego Marcos Segura
items.content: A-Frame co-creator and main maintainer. I was part of the original team at Mozilla that kickstarted the WebVR standard.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Ricardo Cabello – Mr. Doob
items.content:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010. He is currently Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Ayşegül Yönet
items.content: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.

items.title: June Wang
items.content:
Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem.

She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

items.title: Daniel Ljunggren
items.content: Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Brian Kardell
items.content: Brian is a Developer Advocate at Igalia, as well as Original Co-author/Co-signer of The Extensible Web Manifesto. He is active in Web standards, sitting on many working groups and is co-chair of the MathML Working Group, Co-Founder/Chair, W3C Extensible Web CG Member, as well as the AC Representative to the W3C (formerly OpenJS Foundation and now Igalia). He is a blogger and speaker on many web topics.

items.title: James Baicoianu
items.content: Exploring the possibilities of the web

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.

items.title: Athena Demos
items.content: Athena Demos is co-founder and CEO of Big Rock Creative (BRC), an award-winning XR experience company creating groundbreaking experiences for global clients. Big Rock Creative won the Producer’s Guild Award for Innovation, the Aurea Award for creativity, the No Proscenium award for Best VR experience of 2020, the Hermes' Platinum Award, and the Auggie Award for Best Societal Impact of 2022. With over 20 years of experience producing iconic events, like the LA Burning Man Decompression Arts and Music Celebration, as well as the Art of Change Inaugural Ball for President Obama in LA, she transitioned to the metaverse to produce BRCvr (Black Rock City Virtual Reality). BRCvr is an official virtual Burning Man Experience whose scope is unprecedented in the VR space. Athena produced internationally recognized social impact projects such as Breonna’s Garden which premiered at SXSW 2022. She has developed a philosophical approach to guiding humanity to build a foundational fabric for creative collaboration in the metaverse. As a result, she has been quoted in leading books, articles and spoken at leading industry events.

items.title: Doug Jacobson
items.content:
Doug is a co-founder of Big Rock Creative, a XR company producing large
scale events in VR. Big Rock’s first large project, BRCvr, created a fully
immersive Burning Man festival in social VR starting in 2020 which generated
much positive PR including an article in Wired Magazine. Big Rock Creative
won the Producer's Guild innovation award and the Aurea Award. He has
since worked on projects ranging from directing an XR music video featuring
Pitbull, facilitating a Hollywood red carpet premiere in VR or creative directing
the VR version of "Breonna's Garden" that premiered in SXSW 2022.
Doug’s background is in the film industry, he graduated from USC film school
in the 90s with honors. Over the course of his career, he has written,
directed, produced, and edited several festival award-winning narratives and
documentaries. His most notorious documentary features the Burning Man
festival called, “Journey to the flames” which has been screened nationally
and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
American Renaissance” and “The Secret Lives of Adult Stars”, and co-edited
the award-winning short doc “Selling Lies”.

items.title: Elgin-Skye McLaren
items.content:
Elgin-Skye McLaren is a Senior Product Manager for Mozilla Hubs - an open source platform for creating and sharing 3D social spaces on the web.

She holds an MSc in Interactive Arts and Technology from Simon Fraser University. When she isn't working on Hubs or exploring VR she enjoys roller skating and building cool stuff with code.

items.title: Brian Peiris
items.content:
Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community.

Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

items.title: Avi Bar-Zeev
items.content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

items.title: Yinch Yeap
items.content:
Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre. His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks. Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

items.title: Jonathan Hale
items.content: Co-host of the Vhite Rabbit WebXR podcast and one of the original founders of the VR browser games platform \"Construct Arcade\", where he realized the need for WebXR focused development tools, which lead to the inception of Wonderland Engine, a development platform for VR, AR and 3D on the web.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010. He is currently Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Ayşegül Yönet
items.content: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.content:

items.title: Caitlin Krause
items.content:
Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide.

Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Briar Prestidge
items.content:
Briar Prestidge is a serial entrepreneur and CEO of Prestidge Group a leading personal branding, PR and speaker relations agency managing HNWI, C-level executives, technology experts, celebrities, government officials and investors, with offices in Dubai, New York, and London.

A qualified Digital Marketer, Speech-Language Pathologist and Neuro-Linguistic Programming Business Practitioner with an international career for both private and government sectors (originally from a farm in New Zealand), Briar is obsessed with PR, emerging tech, VR/AR and the metaverse, continual learning, business and entrepreneurship.

Prior to establishing Prestidge Group, Briar led communication and digital teams, including executive branding, for many public/ private sector companies, including a government agency rebrand (both digital and comms lead), overseeing all communication touch points, crisis comms strategy, media training for VIPs, and press launch for regional/ international media.

Briar also has a corporate power suit collection BRIAR PRESTIDGE - The Label (www.briarprestidge.com), made from fine wool and cashmere. In 2022, they created their virtual spin-off collection for avatars and dropped NFT suits on leading VR platform, Decentraland, at the World’s First Metaverse Fashion Week.

Briar is also a Strategic Advisor for Scopernia, specialized in preparing companies for a future in Web3, and she sits on the board for the Metaverse Fashion Council.

She was named ‘Top 100 Most Influential’ in the United Arab Emirates, and she has been featured across Entrepreneur, Forbes, OSN, Emirates Women, Marie Claire, Grazia and The National in recognition of her work. In 2022, Briar also received a lot of publicity around her experiment where she spent ’48 hours in the metaverse’ and through her virtual reality world hopping productions.

As a mentor for startups, Briar works with The Founders Institute and one of the world\'s largest entrepreneurial networks, TiE, and she also provides one-on-one and group session consulting.

Briar advocates the role of a healthy body and mind for entrepreneurs and corporate professionals, which is why she wrote the recipe book “Hunger for Success – A recipe book for businesspeople who hate cooking,” to be released in 2022.

When Briar isn’t working or travelling, you can find her at the gym, Pilates or running, spending time with friends (in real life or virtually…), or studying something new.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Damon Hernandez
items.content:
Damon works in many areas of the Web3D & XR industries as a designer, developer, advisor, speaker, entrepreneur and executive that has been active in virtual environments, the 3D web, and other Metaverse related technologies for over 20 years. He is passionate about the web’s convergence with other technologies including 3D, IoT, GIS, CAD/BIM/CAM, AR/VR, mobile and advises a variety of entities that use these technologies for enterprise focused applications. Since 2007, he has been working closely with various built environment professions on the adoption and use of innovative technologies.

Previously he was at SIMLAB, where he was working to make property ownership & management more user friendly for owners via digital twins. At Samsung Research America he focused on making the web browser experience awesome and enhanced with immersive web technologies and new types of interfaces. He is a co-founder of IDEAbuilder, a high tech building company that uses immersive technologies and robotic manufacturing to build more efficiently. He has worked with 3D web and virtual world companies and was acting director of a student initiated organization with the Web3D Consortium, where he worked with the Consortium’s global outreach and education initiatives. He has built numerous mixed reality applications and has lead dozens of research projects in multiple domains.

As founding team member of the Augmented Reality Developer Camps, VR Hackathon, & founder of the AEC Hackathon, he is actively working to help grow the use of innovative technologies.

items.title: Trent Clews-de Castella
items.content:
Trent is on a mission to pioneer immersive technology and transform human experience for good.

To achieve this, Trent believes in the power of storytelling and immersive technology to drive a new paradigm of change and climate action. Through emerging tools like VR, AR MR and WebXR, we can raise awareness for social and environmental impact causes like never before.

As the Co-founder and CEO at PHORIA, a Melbourne-based XR Studio, Trent and his team have been Emmy nominated for their previous work in WebXR with Meta and the International Paralympics Committee. Alongside working closely with respected partners and world leaders including Netflix, Google, WWF and the United Nations (UN).

items.title: Sean Mann
items.content: As CEO of RP1, Sean drives the overall strategic direction of the business, from vision, mission, sales, and go to market strategy. Sean has nearly 25 years of leadership, technology, and entrepreneurial experience in building companies from the ground up. His career experience spans multiple industries, having worked in various B2C and B2B companies, including medical, consumer electronics, software technology, fitness and wellness. He is a visionary leader with deep expertise in business transformation, strategic partnerships, and marketing strategies.

items.title: Daniel Adams
items.content: Daniel Adams is a developer for Zesty Market, creator of the WebXR Discord server (a community of 2000+ members), and a contributor to open-source WebXR projects. Some of his notable work includes Silk Brush, a port of the open-sourced Tilt Brush to WebXR, the updating of A-Painter, and most recently the creation of an A-Frame wrapper for the Exokit Avatars system.

items.title: Ginna Lambert
items.content: Ginna is an experienced VR DP and 360 experience content developer. She enjoys finding new and interesting vantage points for cinematic VR. To date, she has set up cameras on rickshaws, canoes, temples, ferries, cars, balloons, spomeniks, and the occasional migrating zebra herd. In addition to her work with VArtisans, she is also the Director of Content with Conscio VR.

items.title: Wolvic: Assembling The Pack
items.content:
Register Now for the Live 2-Hour Launch Event
November 3rd at 8am Pacific / 11am Eastern / 4pm CET

The Wolvic Browser is the only Open Source Immersive Browser The Reincarnation of Firefox Reality.

You can DOWNLOAD WOLVIC NOW, FREE

Wolvic is Open Source Visit the GitHub Repo,
see the code and contribute to it.

Help fund Wolvic by Joining the Wolvic Open Collective

items.title: Inside Wolvic
items.content: Sophia Moshasha has a conversation with Igalia founders Juan José Sánchez Penas and Sergio Villar Senin to tell the story of how the Wolvic Browser came to be. Mozilla discontinued development of the open-source Firefox® Reality browser in 2020 leaving the community of WebXR developers without a hardware-independent browser. Then Igalia stepped-in, resurrecting and modernizing the code base, and recently released Wolvic! See what opportunities and plans lie ahead for the only Immersive-Only browser in XR.

items.content:
